articles.description: First-time applications for unemployment benefits unexpectedly rose to 419,000 from a pandemic low as COVID-19 cases ticked up
articles.content: WASHINGTON — The number of Americans seeking unemployment benefits rose last week from the lowest point of the pandemic, even as the job market appears to be rebounding on the strength of a reopened … [+4204 chars]

articles.author: Elliot Smith
articles.title: European Central Bank vows a 'persistently accommodative' stance in new guidance - CNBC
articles.description: The European Central Bank on Thursday held monetary policy steady, but tweaked its guidance to reflect its recently-hiked inflation target.
articles.content:
The European Central Bank on Thursday held monetary policy steady, but tweaked its guidance to reflect its recently-hiked inflation target.
